str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

str2: From a compound of a and the base of poreuomai; to have no way out, i.e. Be at a loss.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
A question, debate, controversy; a seeking, search. From zeteo; a searching, i.e. A dispute or its theme.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Optative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma
And there, and yonder, there also. From kai and ekei; likewise in that place.

str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
